items.text: I love being the center of attention and receiving admiration from others.
items.rationale: Desire for admiration and attention is a core aspect of Narcissistic Admiration.

items.text: People often tell me that I have a magnetic personality.
items.rationale: Magnetic personality is associated with the charm and allure of Narcissistic Admiration.

items.text: I frequently fantasize about being recognized for my achievements.
items.rationale: Fantasizing about recognition is indicative of a desire for admiration.

items.text: I often feel like I am destined for greatness.
items.rationale: Feeling destined for greatness reflects a grandiose self-view typical of Narcissistic Admiration.

items.text: I enjoy talking about my accomplishments.
items.rationale: Talking about accomplishments is a way to seek admiration.

items.text: I am often the life of the party.
items.rationale: Being the life of the party suggests a desire for attention and admiration.

items.text: I believe I am a special person.
items.rationale: Believing in one's specialness is a hallmark of Narcissistic Admiration.

items.text: I like to be the one who sets trends.
items.rationale: Setting trends is a way to gain admiration and recognition.

items.text: I often receive compliments on my talents.
items.rationale: Receiving compliments aligns with the admiration-seeking aspect.

items.text: I feel proud when others look up to me.
items.rationale: Feeling proud of being admired is central to Narcissistic Admiration.

items.text: I enjoy being in the spotlight.
items.rationale: Enjoying the spotlight is indicative of a desire for admiration.

items.text: I like to be seen as a leader.
items.rationale: Being seen as a leader is a way to gain admiration.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I deserve more recognition than I get.
items.rationale: Feeling deserving of recognition can indicate admiration-seeking but may also reflect entitlement.

items.text: I often think about how others perceive me.
items.rationale: Concern with perception can indicate admiration-seeking but may also relate to social anxiety.

items.text: I sometimes feel competitive with others who are successful.
items.rationale: Competitiveness can relate to admiration but also to rivalry.

items.text: I often feel the need to put others down to feel better about myself.
items.rationale: Putting others down is a key behavior in Narcissistic Rivalry.

items.text: I get irritated when others do not recognize my achievements.
items.rationale: Irritation at lack of recognition can lead to rivalry.

items.text: I often feel envious of others' success.
items.rationale: Envy is a central component of Narcissistic Rivalry.

items.text: I tend to see others as competition.
items.rationale: Viewing others as competition is a hallmark of Narcissistic Rivalry.

items.text: I feel the need to outdo others.
items.rationale: The need to outdo others is indicative of rivalry.

items.text: I often criticize others to make myself look better.
items.rationale: Criticizing others to elevate oneself is a behavior of Narcissistic Rivalry.

items.text: I feel threatened when others achieve more than I do.
items.rationale: Feeling threatened by others' success is central to rivalry.

items.text: I often feel like others are trying to undermine me.
items.rationale: Feeling undermined is a perception common in Narcissistic Rivalry.

items.text: I enjoy seeing my rivals fail.
items.rationale: Deriving pleasure from others' failures is a key aspect of rivalry.

items.text: I feel a sense of satisfaction when I outperform others.
items.rationale: Satisfaction from outperforming others is indicative of rivalry.

items.text: I often feel like I have to defend my status.
items.rationale: Defending one's status is a behavior associated with rivalry.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I need to prove myself to others.
items.rationale: The need to prove oneself can indicate rivalry but may also relate to self-esteem issues.

items.text: I often feel like others are envious of me.
items.rationale: Feeling envied can indicate rivalry but may also reflect admiration.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I deserve more than others.
items.rationale: Feeling deserving can relate to rivalry but also to admiration.
